channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: D.H.S. Cited Foreign Students’ Writings and Protests Before Their Arrests
item.description: Documents unsealed by a federal judge on Thursday include dossiers that investigators prepared on pro-Palestinian student activists before they were t...

item.title: New York City sues reality TV producer Jordan McGraw, son of ‘Dr. Phil,’ trying to prevent negative police footage from leaking
item.description: “Intended to highlight the extraordinary work of the NYPD” the series, “Behind the Badge” at times portrayed the NYPD negatively, the lawsuit said.

item.title: Hundreds of Minnesota Businesses on Strike in Protest Against ICE
item.description: After protesters called for a pause on economic activity and work to strike against the federal immigration crackdown, many business owners kept their...

item.title: Trump Says He Bruised His Hand on a Table
item.description: The president also said he was prone to bruising because of the high dose of aspirin he has taken daily for three decades.

item.title: After 78 years as a founding member, U.S. fully withdraws from WHO—and it owes over $130 million to the UN agency
item.description: Nearly every country in the world is a member.

item.title: Minneapolis Reveals Where Trump’s Deportation Agenda Is Going
item.description: Caitlin Dickerson, an immigration reporter, explains the different pieces of Trump’s deportation machine.

item.title: The U.S. has 3 of the world’s 240 icebreakers, the crucial shipping technology that would unlock Greenland
item.description: Finland built roughly 60% of the world’s fleet of icebreakers and designed half the rest, says Alberto Rizzi, of the European Council on Foreign Relat...

item.title: Jared Kushner’s dream of a Gaza city full of new skyscrapers clashes with reality of 60 million tons of rubble
item.description: “In the Middle East, they build cities like this ... in three years," Kushner said in a presentation in Davos. “Stuff like this is very doable.”

item.title: 5 Arrested in Shooting of Indiana Judge Steven Meyer and His Wife
item.description: Three people from Indiana and two from Kentucky are in custody, officials said. The judge, Steven Meyer, and his wife were injured but are recovering.

item.title: Taylor Swift’s secret text messages to Blake Lively revealed in court, relevance in dispute
item.description: Swift's messages show that before and after the Justin Baldoni feud became public, Swift was advising Lively how to use power dynamics to her advantag...

item.title: Trump’s Afghanistan War Claim About NATO Soldiers Draws Backlash From UK Politicians
item.description: President Trump said that NATO soldiers stayed “a little off the front lines” during the conflict. In Britain, which lost 457 soldiers in the war, the...

item.title: Trump Says U.S. ‘Armada’ Is Heading to Iran
item.description: President Trump said the United States was “watching Iran” and sending a naval force there, despite also saying this week that his threats had halted ...

item.title: Nazis, Soviets and Trump: America’s Fixation With Greenland
item.description: The idea that Greenland is essential to the United States has returned with a vengeance in the Trump era.

item.title: Vietnam’s Leader Consolidates Power, Pledging ‘New Era of Prosperity’
item.description: To Lam, the head of Vietnam’s Communist Party, will also become president of the nation. His new stature comes with new risks.

item.title: What’s It Like to Climb a Skyscraper?
item.description: Few climbers take on this niche pursuit, where one mistake could mean death. Three of them talk about its unique mental and physical demands.
